item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: This, in fact, was my first post written entirely in Vim! I typically use Visual Studio Code but recently decided to become more comfortable with keyboard shortcuts. In the process I got more accustomed to visual mode, and finally got around to figuring out buffers. ðŸ˜… Remarkably, now when I go back to VSC it feels slow! https://victoria.dev/verbose/sql-injection-and-xss-what-white-hat-hackers-know-about-trusting-user-input/

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: Wanted: ability to grep IRL, as in, grep -Hrnwiv soy frozen_food_aisle/ … Ok ok H: with filename r: recursive n: print line number in file w: match the whole word i: ignore case v: invert matching (select non-matching lines)

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: I know I’m really excited about the thing I’m working on when I get so hungry that I can’t concentrate any longer and have to stop to make food, but mostly I’m annoyed that I can’t make food and type at the same time.

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: Search and replace a word in Vim: :%s/\<word\>/newword/g The % indicates to look in all lines of the current file; s is for substitute; \<word\> matches the whole word; and the g is for globally, ie. every occurrence. Or use gc at the end there, if you want to confirm (c) each change.

item.description: Sooo if you sudo apt remove python3 on Ubuntu, the desktop goes away. ðŸ¥º sudo apt install ubuntu-desktop brings it back. ðŸ˜„

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: A quick way to clone a list of @GitHub repos. Given a file, repos.txt with a repository’s SSH link on each line (and your SSH keys set up), run: xargs -n1 git clone < repos.txt Will clone all repositories into the current folder.

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: I think you can learn more about someone’s true character from their Audible library than their Twitter feed.

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: Add the current git branch to your bash prompt! In .bashrc: parse_git_branch() { git branch 2> /dev/null | sed -e '/^[^*]/d' -e 's/* \(.*\)/(\1)/' } if [ "$color_prompt" = yes ]; then PS1='${debian_chroot:+($debian_chroot)}\[\033[0;1;38;5;247m\]> \[\033[3;38;5;68m\]\W $(parse_git_branch)\[\033[00m\] ' else PS1='${debian_chroot:+($debian_chroot)}\W $(parse_git_branch)\[\033[00m\] ' fi No more accidentally merging master into your this-seems-like-a-good-idea branch!

item.description: New rule: if non-critical item sits on the to-do list for more than three days, delete it.

item.author: hello@victoria.dev (Victoria)
item.description: What I really want out of face-recognition technology is software that blanks my screen if it detects a face other than my own looking at it. Instead, I get Animojis. Glad we’ve got our priorities straight.
